definition[0]: if a solid dissolves, or if you dissolve it, it mixes with a liquid and becomes part of it
definition[1]: to formally end a parliament, business arrangement, marriage etc
example[3]: The monarch had the power to dissolve parliament.
definition[2]: to gradually become smaller or weaker before disappearing, or to make something do this
example[5]: A few clouds formed briefly before dissolving again.
definition[3]: to bring a company or PARTNERSHIP to an end officially
example[6]: He announced that he was dissolving the company because of financial problems.
